text: Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Bruin kleurig bier met een creme kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: banaan, karamel, gist en wat mout.

Smaak: zoet, wat gist, karamel en wat geroosterd.

Piwo wygląda świetnie, mętne ciemno-bursztynowe z przepiękną i trwałą pianą. W aromacie głównie goździk i coś kłującego co jest raczej nieprzyjemne. W smaku dobrze i hefeweizenowo ale bez szaleństwa jeśli chodzi o paloność. Prawie niewyczuwalne są nuty kawy czy czekolady.
Butelka 0,5l. W aromacie goździk, banan, trochę nut chlebowych. W smaku więcej chlebowości, ciemne słody. Wszystko ładnie zgrane.
Bottled. Nice hefeweizen base combined with roasted malts in aroma and taste. Light bodied and softly carbonated.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

A:Bready cloves light spicy.
F: light close, banana hint of bubblegum. Doughy. Some light sweetness
M: medium-medium high body high carbonation. Creamy.
O: very nice one

Color marrón oscuro y turbio con una cabeza de color esponjoso y huevo. Olores de especias picante y una buena cantidad de maltas toffee, junto con caramelo esmaltado. Tiene una sensación de boca suave y ligera con una carbonatación vívida, calmada por la levadura suave y picante. Cerveza muy bien equilibrada, fácil de beber en grandes tragos, mientras que proporciona un refresco efervescente y suave. Los sabores de pimienta negra condimentan especias, con un sabor dulce inmediato que viene de las maltas del caramelo, que consiguen equilibradas por la tierra seca, el trigo rico y la carbonación efervescente. Acabados finos y sin incidentes con sólo una nota de las especias predominantes en el paladar. Muy ligero para el estilo con un perfil de especias agradable. Buena cerveza.

(500 ml bottle) Aroma: banana, mainly, cloves, maybe some caramel, some sulfurish aromas?
Appearance: Reddish, cloudy, with frothy head, maybe slightly tanned.
Taste: Sweet, mainly from bananas. lightly sour. Its metalic - and the metalic flavour is actually quite strong here. Bananas and cloves are here for sure, some caramel too. But in general its quite empty. And metalic aromas actually intensifies its emptiness (at least in my case)
Palate: light body, very light, creamy, average carbonation.
Overall: Hard to say - aroma is not that bad, bananas are there, cloves too, some caramel too. But Taste is simply bad, its metalic, its empty. If you have nothing more to drink, then thats an option.
Barwa ciemnobrązowa, wysoka piana. W aromacie pszenica i banan. W smaku słodowo, również banan, karmel, lekko kwaskowate. Niewielka goryczka. Dość gładkie, łatwo się pije.

Aroma of cloves, bananas and malty caramel sweetness. Pours in cloudy brown with a tall sturdy white head. Long lasting with nice lacing. First sip starts with roasted notes of caramel, followed by typical sweetness. Medium bodied, slightly creamy and sticky with average carbonation. Overall very nice.

Flasche in einem Restaurant
Braun, etwas beiger Schaum.
Aroma: Banane, Malz, Hefe
Geschmack: Karamell, Schokolade, etwas Banane, süßlich

Ciemna odmiana Paulanera ma miedzianą barwę, jest mętna i poszczycić się może całkiem sporą, zwartą, białą pianą. Aromat bananów i przypraw. W smaku również banany, nieco przypraw i karmelu. W sumie przyjemne w odbiorze, smaczne piwo!
[Butelka 07.2017] Nadal solidne, choć wg mnie gorsze niż jasny weizen. Trochę słodowe, karmelowe.
Uzupełnienie z notatek. Trochę słodsze od jasnego, karmelowe, mulące. Dodatkowo ostatnio mocno poszła w dół jakość, przynajmniej tych dostępnych w Polsce

500 ml bottle (brown sticker). Pours murky rusty orange to creamy brown colour. Tall everlasting fluffy off-white head. Intense carbonation. Aroma: cocoa beans, clove, lots of spices, banana, toffee, sweet esters. Flavour is banana, toffee, red apple sweetish sourness; spicy phenols. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Gentle bitter finish. Classic and solid brew.
Barwa ciemno miedziana, piana obfita. Aromat bananowy, czekoladowy, dyniowy. W smaku guma bananowa, karmel, goryczka mała. Ciekawe pifko
50cl bottle purchased @ Tante Emma Laden. Couleur beige trouble avec fine mousse. Beaux arômes de banane et de caramel.
Bottle. Aroma and taste is dominated by banana and wheat. Some herbs in the aroma and some toffee in the taste also. Sweet mouthfeel.

0.5 bottle. Murky brown, beige head. Nose: salt caramel, toffee, toast/bread, wheat, bananas. Medium body, maybe a bit watery. Medium carbonation. Flavors: bananas, a bit of tart sourness, bread, dark fruits. Really enjoyable.

Clásica cerveza de trigo bávara, con aspecto marrón y turbio y una amplísima corona de espuma blanca con algún tono rojizo.

 Muy bien carbonatada, es una cerveza con textura cremosa, fresca y fácil de beber. A los aromas típicos de plátano y especias y al sabor característico de este tipo de elaboraciones, como el caramelo, hay que añadirle además notas tostadas y de chocolate debido a la adición de maltas muy tostadas (valga la redundancia).
 
En resumen, una rica cerveza de trigo con la que (si eres fan del estilo) puedes dar un pasito más añadiéndole a las sensaciones los tonos tostados sin perder frescura.
Wypite jakis czas temu, ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu. Nie smakowalo mi zbytnio

Murky brown beer, thin white head. Light smell of toffee, malt and a touch of chocolate. Flavour has the same qualities, while being pretty mellow and very smooth. Not the most distinct dunkel going but extremely drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 AROMAT: banan; trochę wyczuwalna lekka, delikatna czekolada; minimalny dym na początku; leciutka dynia. WYGLĄD: Piana obfita, średniopęcherzykowa szybkoopadająca w kolorze biało kremowym ,troszkę w stronę żółci; piwo w kolorze pomarańczowo-miedziano-brunatnym. SMAK: banan tudzież guma, choć w stronę banana, bardziej naturalny smak bananowy niż sztuczny gumowy; troszkę więcej chmielowe, ale gorycz raczej na niższych poziomach. Ogólnie to nieco bardziej treściwe niż zwykły weizen, wciąż dobrze pijalny, ale przydało by się trochę więcej charakteru ciemnego piwa.

Banana, caramel, bread in nose. Pours brown with white head. Taste is medium sweet with banana and caramel followed by coriander and bread. Low bitter, mild sour finish, lively carbonation. Overall well done.

Bottle. Dark amber, dirty, with big white but not very solid head, good lacing. Aromas of bananas, bread, caramel quite strong and solid, some citrus tones in the background. Taste is sweet with very light sour finish. Dry, light to medium body, average carbonated (right for the style), creamy mouth feel. Really a good one.

Bottle from Biertempel: Dark brown hazy color, brownish head. Aroma has roastiness, some chocolate, wheat, acid, some fruitiness. Flavor is roasty, berries, some banana, wheat, yeast, cacao. Good one.
Aromat cytrusy, banany, karmel, paloność. Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, piana ładna, drobnopęcherzykowa. W smaku cytrusy, kamel, banany, trochę słodkie. Goryczka średnia.
0,5l Flasche. Trübes braunes Bier, schöner Schaum. Brotkruste und Karamel in der Nase. Runder malziger Geschmack. Etwas Karamel. Lecker.

50cl bottle at mr. Mofongo in Groningen. Pours a cloudy dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, caramel, banana, bread. Taste is sweet, light bitter with a soft dry finish. Notes of caramel, malt, caramel, toffee, yeast, dark fruit. Texture is sticky, medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation
Barwa ciemnobrunatna. Piana obfita, ale krótko si? utrzymuje. W aromacie mocno wyczuwalny karmel. Smak banana i karmelu. Goryczka nisko-?rednia.
boca, kad se uliva u čau daje predivnu tamnu boju sa pjenom koja brzo nestaje...finog okusa...HV
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer

Bottle. This is a good looking beer that tastes great as well. Cloudy amber-brown with a frothy white head and nice lacing. Nose of citrus, banana, caramel and cooked bread. Taste is light to medium sweet and sour, with hints of biterness on finish. High carbonation, lovely creamy texture. Nice!

Bottle : 500 ml
Tamsiai ruda spalva, putos beveik nėr, eilinis skonis..

Bottle. Brown/orange. Lovely head. Aroma is mostly yeast and a dash of lemons. Taste is yeast, lemons, malts and bananas. Good carbonation. Very balanced. Refreshing, light and extremely süffig. Very good Dunkelweizen.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a pale tan head. Fruity aromas, mild but really nice: cinnamon, caramel. Flavours include some yeast and mellow spiciness, quickly giving way to wheat, only slightly grainy. Delicious. Oily, mild to medium body and weissbier finish. I enjoyed it a lot.

Piwo o ciemno brązowej barwie, po nalaniu piana na około 2 palce lecz dosyć szybko opada praktycznie do zera, nie pozostawiając nic na szkle. W aromacie też niewiele się dzieje, mianowicie słaba nuta karmelowa, pszeniczna oraz lekkie owoce, może ledwo wyczuwalny banan,ale te aromaty są naprawdę słabo wyczuwalne trzeba się trochę postarać żeby je wyczuć.
W smaku natomiast jest już lepiej wyczuwalny banan,karmel, oraz pszeniczność.
Wysycenie na wysokim poziomie przez co piwo jest orzeźwiające. Pojawia się lekka kwaskowość, na finiszu lekka słodycz karmelowa ale naprawdę minimalna.
Piłem ostatnio paulanera hefe-weisbier naturtrub i moim zdaniem był znacznie lepszy, lecz to piwo jest i tak dosyć przyzwoite.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Piękna, bujna czapa piany. Aromat - przejrzałe banany, lekki karmel. Jest przyjemnie i intensywnie. W smaku na szczęście więcej jest mączystych bananów niż karmelu, który tylko uzupełnia kompozycję. Przyjemnie kwaskowate, wysokie nasycenie. Trochę wodniste jest momentami, no ale pewnych rzeczy się nie przeskoczy. Świetne piwo, łatwo dostępne nawet w podrzędnych barach, piłbym litrami:P
Nu er jeg ikke den store tilhænger af hvedeøl, så jeg synes nu ikke det er det store sus. Men den smager da helt klart af hvedeøl
500ml bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. . Pours reddish brown with a full head. Aroma of dark fruits,wheat Flavour of caramel, slightly peppery. Thin mouthful at the end but enjoyable overall.

Brązowe piwi z wysokoą drobnopęcherzykową pianą. W aromacie banany, goździki, delikatnie czuć karmel. W smaku jabłka, banany, goździki. Nut karmekowych musiałem się bardziej domyślać niż naprawdę tam występowały w sumie piwo mało się różni od swojej "białej" wersji.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Piwo barwy jasno brązowej o znacznym zmętnieniu z jasno-beżową obfitą drobno pęcherzykową pianą która trzyma się bardzo długo. W aromacie przede wszytkim banany i kakao oraz nieco karmelu. W smaku typowe weizenowe nuty: banan, aromaty drożdżowe, zbożowe, oprócz tego tofii i kakao. Całkiem pijalne o średnio wysokim nasyceniu. Klasyczny, bardzo smaczny Dunkelweizen
Bottle 500ml. Cloudy appeal, white cream head, caramel taste. Excelent Beer!
Appearance: cloudy brown with large beige head. Aroma: malt, vague roast. Taste: sourbitter. Palate: refreshing, medium body, lively carbonation. Overall: very nice.

Keg at The Castle Tap, Reading, Berks. Reddy brown with cream head. There is a fusty note at the start of this, cereal, wheaty with a sweetish, caramelised note. A little unbalanced, unusual for this brewery. Just okay.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 Bottle. Cloudy brown colour, lasting off-white creamy head. Cloves, bananas and caramel in aroma. Flavor is light sour and light sweet, wheat, caramel, bread. Smooth, but it feels a little thin and not perfectly balanced. Overall decent.
Old review written before making ratebeer account. Mmmm, not precisely what I had hoped for.

- trüblich braune Farbe mit sehr guter Schaumbildung
- gut wahrnehmbare Aromen nach Banane, Brot und Hefe
- die Carbonisierung ist mir eine Spur zu hoch
- und genau dieses zuviel hinterlässt ein säuerliches Mundgefühl
- geschmacklich kommen jetzt noch leichte Röstmalze hinzu, welche
 das Ganze auch nicht mehr retten
- der Abgang bleibt dann einfach zu wässrig
Fazit: Dunkel und schlecht

I bought this bottle at Drink of the world in Zürich. I drank it quietly at home in Lausanne. In my opinion, this one is better than the Erdinger. The taste is with wheat, nice touch of bitterness at the end,
a bit watery, overall well-balaned.

500ml bottle. BB 02/17
Typical phenolic wheat beer aroma.
Hazy brown color with plenty of creamy head and thick lacing.
Sweet bubblegum phenolic taste upfront with a smooth restrained finish but lacking body.

Piwo metne w kolorze brazowym z bezowa obfita grubopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie palone slody z dodatkiem owocow, bananow i gozdzikow. W smaku czujemy to samo jak przystalo na pszeniczniaka. Sa drozdze i banany, przyprawy i karmel. Dosc lekkie i pijalne z wysokim nasyceniem i bardzo niska goryczka.

Butelka 500ml Pod Minoga -Poznan, Kolor ciemnobrunatny z bursztynowym refleksem. Piana srednia palona szybko opada. W smaku i aromacie typowe banany kolendra toffi ciemne slody karmel podbudowane pieprzowo- ziolowa nuta. Piwo dosc slodkie o niskiej karbonacji wrecz wodniste na finiszu, przez co latwo pijalne. Szkoda ze niektore ze smakow tak malo zaakcentowane..

Pours amber colour with a beige head. Aroma of bananas, caramel, cloves. Really nice. Taste is medium sweet. Low bitterness. Medium bodied. Very smooth texture. Highly carbonated. Such a pleasant beer

Pours a murky, dark brown color with a fluffy, egg shell colored head.

Smells of peppery spices and a fair amount of toffee malts, together with glazed caramel.

Has a very soft, light mouthfeel with a vivid carbonation, soothed by the soft, spicy yeast. Very well balanced beer, easy to drink in big gulps, while providing an effervescent, smooth refreshment.

Tastes of black pepper driven spices, with get an immediate sweet flavor coming from toffee malts, which get balanced by dried earth, rich wheat and the effervescent carbonation. Finishes a little thin and uneventful with just a note of prevailing spices maintaining on the palate. 

Very light for the style with a nice spice profile to it, which receeds a little to early, opening up the palate to a boring finish.

Bottle from Bavarian Beer Cafe 071016. This is a good looking beer that tasyes great as well. Big puffy head of thick foam above a reddish brown thin bodied beer. Banana, plum and raisins in the flavour. This beer went down a treat.
Aroma: roasted malts and toast with a slight rich fruit aroma. Appearance: dark brown in colour with a medium off-white head. Taste: banana and citrus with a yeast-like finish.

Cloudy amber-brown with a frothy offwhite head and nice lacing. Nose of citrus, banana, clove, caramel, cooked bread. Taste is light to medium sweet and sour, hints of bitterness on finish. High carbonation, lovely creamy/frothy texture, some stickiness. Nice!

Servida en vaso weizen.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón con algunos destellos cafés claros a contraluz, se observa turbia con una mediana actividad de carbonatación. Corona de espuma ligeramente marfil, copiosa y persiste, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: pan, plátano, pimienta y ligeramente clavo de la levadura, muy ligeramente algo cítrico como naranja madura, grano tostado y nueces de manera muy discreta, dulzor ligero de las maltas.

SABOR: sigue al aroma, notas de pan, plátano, pimienta y ligeramente clavo de la levadura, muy ligeramente notas cítricas como naranja madura, grano tostado y nueces de manera muy discreta, dulzor ligero de las maltas, todo bien balanceado. El retrogusto con un amargor ligero con persistencia de las notas cítricas, ligeramente dulce y algo del tostado, nada astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero con sensación sedosa, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: una buena cerveza de acuerdo al estilo.

Aroma de uma weiss comum, porém com leve adição de malte tostado. Marrom escuro e turvo, além da excelente formação de espuma. No paladar, malte tostado, banana, leve retrogosto de maltes torrados. Boa cerveja.
Dark amber with rich off white creamy head.Malty roasted aroma. Medium bitter and sweet sour taste, notes of roasted grain and coriander.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi.

Nice bottle but no detail information about the hops, malts and drinktemperature.
Cloudy dark-amber beer with a very good rocky cappuccino head, head is very stable and very nice, smell is banana, fizzy carbonation, good balance between banana and roasty, little herb, long finish,
(I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 04.17 D and batch L19462H)
Bottle at home. Brown-mahagony colour good fluffy longlasting white head. Nose is light banana esters. Taste is low bitterness, low sweetness. A nice dunkelweizen.

Niente male questa Dunkel. Colore ambra scuro, schiuma biancastra compatta e persistente. Aroma di lievito e banana. Al palato banana, frutta, lievito, malto. Dolcezza decisa. Carbonazione non elevata.
Turbid brownish liquid wih nice big white head. Nice aroma of bread and banana. Taste is toffee and wheat with long finish. Really good, i suppose you cannot miss with Paulaner.

Bottle. Pours is cloudy amber to brownish with thick off-white head. Aroma is fruity, peach, banana with touch of caramel and hazelnut. Taste is light to moderate sweet, with caramel and biscuity notes on tongue. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.
Bottle 500ml. Cloudy appeal, white cream head. Caramel aroma. In the mouth, medium bodied, caramel and cloves taste. Excelent Beer!
draught @ német sörfeszt (budapest) hazy brownish colour, light body, normal carbonated, malty, sweety, bit spicy, easy to drink

Bottle 50 cl, brown hazy color, large head, nice aroma of yeast, banana, caramel. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is light bitter at the beginning, light sweet at middle and light sour aftertaste. A good beer, but a little to expensive.

On tap at Paulaner im Tal. Aroma is subdued, but theres a sharp maltiness and once it warms theres a little tart tropical fruit coming through. Pours a flat cloudy dark brown, though its actually a little too carbonated. Taste is biscuits up front with some spice and plum after. Finish is much more malty and bitter than I would anticipate or want, with a very small amount of mango trying to fight through.
Boca 0.5L ravno iz Njemačke...odičan miris banane, aroma....ma njemački dunkel ne moe ne valjati pogotovo ako dolazi od Paulanera, meni odlično pivo...
500ml bottle. Pours hazy brown with large head. Aroma of clove, banana, caramel, grains, yeast. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and a bit sour in the finish.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Banan, goździk, lekkie ciasteczko. Średnie ciało. Wysokie wysycenie. Poprawny przedstawiciel stylu.
Brown color. Big head. Carbonation is middle. Bananas, wheat bread and yeasts in the aroma. Little sourness in the finish.

Appearance: cloudy brown with large beige head.
Aroma: malt, vague roast.
Taste: sourbitter.
Palate: refreshing, medium body, lively carbonation.
Overall: very nice.

Probada en botella de 500 ml adquirida en Pinta Point Belgrano, Buenos Aires. Color marrón opaco, cuerpo medio. Espuma persistente. Aroma a tostado y chocolate. Buen balance de sabor en donde predomina el cítrico. Agradable dejó en el paladar. 6.5/10.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle straight from Munich. CLoudy brown with long lasting dense head and lace. Clove spicy aroma with some toasted caramel and nuts. Very light toast caramel sweetness with ripe red apple and peach. Grassy minerally earthy light bitter dry finish. LIght soft body. Pretty much a masterpiece.

Piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowata, długo sie utrzymująca. Kolor miedziany i bardzo mętny. W zapachu banan i troche goździka. Bardzo mocno nasycone, może nawet jak na pszeniczniaka to za bardzo. W smaku ponownie typowy pszeniczniak, lecz troche wodnisty i płaski. Goryczki brak.

Roba ambrée, belle mousse abondante. Nez frais sur des notes dagrumes, de céréales, sur un fond métallique. Bouche à lattaque fraîche et épicée, une belle trame acidulée, fine bulle et finale raffraîchissante. Une belle bière de soif.

Enjoyed: On tap.
Appearance: Hazy brown colour, with rich long-lived dirty-white foam. 
Aroma: Fruit, chocolate.
Palate: Medium body, low carbonation.
Taste: Sweet, fruity, banana, classic wheat.
Overall impression: Enjoyable.

Definitely one of the best high volume beers from Paulaner. Retains the candied fruit of the straight hefe but adds to the mix a layer of grainy light milk chocolate. Near perfect session beer for mine and particular so in the Phuket climate.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 50cl-fles in Center Parcs Kempervennen. U: troebel bruin met beige schuimkraag. G: karamel, tarwe en ook een klein beetje hop. S: karamelzoetig met een zeer klein zuurtje in de afdronk.

Hazy brown coloured beer with a nood so good lasting, rocky, off-white, head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, some toffee, light citrus, some floweriness. More roasted malt in taste, clove, typical wheat beer taste, overall sweet with some subtle roast malt bitterness towards the finish. Sticky texture, average carbonation, medium body. Nothing extraordinary.

500ml bottle. It is not my favourite, but a good hefeweissbier. Large foam, sticky body, pale brown, hazy colour describe the beer. Taste is sweetness and some citrus at the end of gulp, hop almost none there. Not bad, not good.

Aspecto: Color pardo anaranjado, espuma blanca y textura jabonosa, poro 	abierto
Aroma: a caramelo, tostado (malta de trigo tostada), plátano
Sabor: en boca es dulce y se nota la malta tostada con toques a caramelo, 	según evoluciona el trago se nota el sabor a plátano

Piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowata, długo sie utrzymująca. Kolor miedziany i bardzo mętny. W zapachu banan i troche goździka. Bardzo mocno nasycone, może nawet jak na pszeniczniaka to za bardzo. W smaku ponownie typowy pszeniczniak, lecz troche wodnisty i płaski. Goryczki brak. Brakuje mi efektów użycia ciemnych słodów poza barwą. Na upartego da się ale troche jak dla mnie na granicy autosugestii. Ogólnie nie zły, ale płaski hefeweizen

Bottle. Dark cloudy brown with a thick off white head. Fruity and malty tones. 
Banana, malt, caramel and hops. Medium body with a nice fruity /malty finish.

Nie wiem - może trafiłem na słabą warkę. W każdym razie aromat jest dosyć nkły - bananowo-goździkowy. Smak analogiczny, aczkolwiek niesamowicie wodnisty. Występuje nawet lekka goryczka. Piana jest bardzo obfita i długo się utrzymuje. Kolor ciemny. Bardzo przeciętne.
Barwa ciemnobrązowa, piana obfita, wolno opada, później stale utrzymuje się jej centymetrowa warstwa. W aromacie jak i w smaku czuć banana. Oprócz tego dosyć wyraźnia jak na weizena goryczka.

50cl bottle shared. 
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy amber pour. Very good.
Bottle 0.5l, prachtige bruingouden kleur, stevige crèmekleurige schuimkraag, bitterzoet, zweem van noten, ik zeg gewoon doen, hoge kwaliteit
Correct dunkelweizen with any major flaws, a little bit too much co2, but it fits the style, not so drinkable, but refreshing and tasteful.

De la macro cervecera Paulaner Gruppe esta "Paulaner Hefeweizen Dunkel" una cerveza tradicional bávara en su versión obscura(Dunkel significa obscuro), una cervecera de mucha tradición y el principal sponsor del OctobeerFest, contiene 5.3% ABV.
En apariencia propone una cabeza copiosa de tono cristalino, con burbuja compacta y magnifica retención no se puede llegar a apreciar bien la actividad de carbonatación por la basta turbiedad que tiene acompañada de un color marrón medio y destellos cobrizos, un cuerpo ligeramente medio. En roma es bastante dominante la malta de trigo, con ligeros toques a pan tostados, mucho olor a platano característico de la levadura fenolica y especiada a clavo y algo de acidez, no tiene carácter marcado de los lúpulos. Las impresiones que detecto en el paladar son inicialmente a platano, toques moderados de la malta tostada, cereales, nota dulce y especiada a clavo y algo de coriandro con cierto dejo de acidez que no es agresivo al paladar y si distintivo de la molienda mayoritariamente de trigo que caracteriza los estilos bávaros, una gran cerveza que aun siendo una macro permanece con recetas tradicionales y bien cuidadas que proponen sabores diferentes a las típicas lager.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Classic, standard Bavarian Dunkelweizen, had this many years ago but now re-rating from a bottle of a few months old.  Shows the expected frothy, rocky, dense, foamy, pale beige-tinted head (the colour of which reveals the use of dark malts, of course) and a beautiful deep coppery mahogany colour, lightly haze, while a steady stream of powerful fizz rises up from the bottom of the glass - a pretty sight, as usual with these beers, when poured in a Weissbier vase...  Aroma of fudge, banana cake, gingerbread, soapy wheat, tea leaves, dried orange peel, apricot, freshly baked brown bread, some undisturbingly natural iron, subtler hints of cocoa powder, hazelnut paste, fresh grass, cloves, vague sweaty grain accent.  Fruity onset with classic sweet and sour balance, the expected banana of course but paired well with hints of red apple, peach and sweet berries; carbo is on the soft side for the style, emphasizing a fluffy, soft, lovely smooth mouthfeel.  Bready, lightly biscuity and notably caramelly barley prevails in the middle, but a soapy, gently sourish wheat presence comes from underneath and refreshes the finish, which is further adorned with retronasal dried fruit esters and subtle but unmistakable clove-like phenols, as well as a faraway, earthy, very faintly spicy but otherwise totally soft hop presence lending only the thinnest and briefest, but structurally important glimpse of bitterness.  Juicy caramelly malt sweetness and soapy wheats linger on after swallowing.  Friendly, gentle, fluffy, juicy: this is everything a decent, traditional Dunkelweizen has to be, nothing more, nothing less.  Classic in every sense of the word and seen the relative ease with which this can be obtained, an ideal acquaintance with the style.

500 ml bottle. Dark brown with amber hues. Coarse light beige to brown head. Bread and banana with hints of vanilla. Soft wheaty texture. Lively carbonation. Some residual sweetness cuts through the carbonation. Overall a nicely balanced beer. Surprisingly light in colour for a dunkelweizen. Very drinkable nonetheless.

0.5L bottle in Berlin. Smells of toasted malt, bread, and wheat. Tastes strongly of wheat and roasted malt with hints of toffee, caramel, and spice, and slight bitterness. Also a slight hint of banana. Quite enjoyable with a fresh, crisp feel.

@ brewpub. Too muddy looking but the head lasts. Clean aroma with great malt character. Yeasty palate. Very clean flavors with subtle carob and banana flavors. Impressive.Earlier Rating: 1/21/2010 Total Score: 3.2Bottle @ Guilin Paulaner. Hazy brown with thick, lasting head. yeasty aroma is chocolate banana bread with custard. Soft, easy palate. Cocoa is in the background all the way in the decent beer.
Flaske 50 cl. Ugennemsigtig mørk hælde med et orange / gul skær. Stor varende off white krone. Aroma og smag af malt, hvede og korn noter af lys karamel. Forfriskende og dejlig.
Poured brown in colour with white head. Aroma is sweet wheat and light fruitiness. Flavour similar.

A - hazy orange with gold tones with very good and nice head
S - bananas, yeast, ananas, dark bread
T - nice taste of dark bread, banana (especially banana juice), citruses, earthiness, herbs and nice and light end
M - low to medium carbonation with medium body
D - very very drinkable.. the taste of bread makes it heavy, however the banana and citruses makes it fresh and easy and it has not so high ABV, so very drinkable
Mia moglie è innamorata delle dunkelweizen, e io dove le trovo gliele compro ma a me piacciono appena, anche se questa è un pò meglio di altre...

Gesztenyemézhez hasonlatos szín, egy narancssárgás árnyalattal megdobva, eléggé piszkosfehér habja krémes és kitartó. Illata gyümölcsös: banán és más trópusi gyümölcsök, meg egy kis fűszeresség és élesztő. Édeskés ízében is a banán dominál, kis vaníliás puding hatással ötvözve. Lecsengése fűszeres, banánosan és búzamalátásan édeskés utóíze pedig jó hosszan kitart. Nagyon lehet pusztítani, kár, hogy csak egy üveggel van otthon. Egyébként nagyon hasonló a világos változatához.

Great beer. 2 good styles come together to create a great tasting well balanced beer with somewhat complex tastes,, but mostly just a semi strong overall good drinking beer.  The taste is bread, cereal, carmel back, with a marzen type character. Rich, almost creamy consistency. Color is great, smell is wondorus. Lastly the palate and smell are right on. Great offering from a serious German beer company

.5 liter bottle.  Pours a hazed deep woody amber brown with a medium lasting off white head.  Aroma is banana, fruity esters, clove-like phenols mixed with peppery spice, sweet honey, caramel malts, wheat and doughy pils.  Flavor is light toast, some burnt notes, fruity- banana and raisin, grass, slight phenolic, spice, pepper, honey sweetness and brown sugar and toffee in the end.  Finish is slightly slick, but ok overall.

So far one of the best Dunkels Ive had the pleasure of tasting.  Average body, not too filling, very pleasant aroma.  A darker beer that I consider not all that "dark."  I love keeping a case downstairs for special occasions, but not something Id let my pals take free run of...its too good!
Bottled. Dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma, orange, banana, maybe honey. Taste, caramel with banana touch, nice citrus finish. Drinkable beer.

Pours hazy brown with huge tanned head leaving some lacing. Aroma is malty, hay, a bit sweet with tones of citrus fruits. Sweet acidy mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet malty, raisins, fruits and floral. Acidy flat palate. Finishes first sweet acidy turning into a short hoopy aftertaste.
Bottle.  Variegated caramel color, fluffy tan head.  Aroma of citrus and bubblegum.  Taste is sticky, malty, citrus.  Decent.

Served into a Erdinger weizen glass

A: Amber hazy, white frothy head that quickly disipates into a thin lace.

S: Yeasty, sweet burnt caramel, banana, raisins, bready, alcohol.

T: Almost the same as the smell but with a little bit of spiciness thta I suppose comes from the carbonation, medium bodied, not much bitternes.

Overall a delicious summer beer with a hint of fruits and very refreshing
Bottle of Morfar Ginko, Stockholm, Sweden. Very light appearance and thin head. Taste is very sweet and a light sour taste in the onset.
On tap at Paulaner Brewery; aroma of orange and spice. Taste of subtle orange and spcie notes, very creamy ... easy drinking. Very comparble to Hacker Pschorr (Less citrus, more balanced)

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity wall adhesive light brown foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. The beer has a thick brown color and a sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a caramally touch. This beer smells fruity.
bottle. very good dunkelweissen with good aroma and taste, pleasant palate and nice dark brown color.
Alla spina al Paulaner di Lubeck; colore tonaca di frate, schiuma solida e persistente, non sa di molto, passabile

Bottle @ home. Hazy brownish caramel pour, small off white head.
Aroma of banana, caramel, wheat and spices.
Flavour is metallic caramel, lemon, banana and spices.
Okay but nothing special.

Bottle 50cl. A cloudy deep copper-brown ale with nice head. Aroma is nice on cereals, wheat, and fruit astringency, quite creamy and very round. This dunkel beer is nice, body is a bit low and some acidity at the finish but very drinkablen, should be just more malty.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy mid-brown, with a large head, good retention and great lacing. Theres a hint of that typical weizen banana on the nose, but it lurks behind some stronger, darker caramel and cinnamon notes. Theres some nice citrus bitterness to begin, with caramel, cinnamon and banana coming through in the middle. It finishes with the merest hint of sweet orange on the aftertaste. A good solid dunkelweizen, and excellent paired with real hearty European food.
Bottle. Hazy brown. Huge head. Yeasty aroma. Slightly more malty and toasty than the regular hefe but that wont let the citric and fruity tastes come through.

Szép ködös borostyán színű főzet, tetején egy impozáns és tartós, piszkosfehér színű, habkoronával.
Illata érett banánhoz hasonlatos ill. fűszeres.
Csípősen, savasan indul, testét picit vékonynak találom.
íze (sült) gyümölcsös, aromája szegfűszeges, karamellás, gabonás és élesztős.
Fanyar vége egy jófajta fűszeres és száraz, mely kellemes utóízben marad meg.
Összességében kellemes stb., de volt már szerencsém ennél jobb barna búzasörhöz is...
50 cl bottle. Murky dark amber/brown with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, wheat, caramel, fruit and banana.
Bottle BBE December 2009! Dark orange colour with beige head. Sweet caramelly aroma and taste with a touch of sourness. Medium body and a bit watery mouthfeel. Well balanced and enjoyable!
Hazy brown body, whiteish head. Aroma of banana, butterscotch and butter. Very well carbonated. Flavour has some malty backbone too.
500 ml bottle a brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruits and caramel taste malts spices caramel some fruits and hop
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2010 A very fine Dunkel beer,smooth,tastefull and with an enchanting aroma.Easy to drink,though I dont really enjoyheffe weiss beers...

Bottle.  poured with a huge eggshell head with great lasting power; coppery, hazy brown color.  Some sulfur that really sucks in the aroma, banana, and light citrus.  Tastes much better than the aroma; bananas and toffee; not bad at all.  Medium body with bubbles, nice brew.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a murky, brown colour with a large, fluffy, off-white head and great lacing. Plenty of carbonation. Aroma is of banana, spices and wheat, pretty faint though. Taste is soft and easy to drink, typical weizen flavours (bubblegum, banana, etc.) with an uncharacteristic but nice bitter finish. Good.

Hefe-Weizen Dunkel--1999 16.9 oz. Bottle. 5.20% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Dunkelweizen. Hazy amber color turns brown with pellicle. Light yeast front gives way to rich thick malty body. Light sweet fruit flavor with good spice accents on top of roasted caramel body. Spice hop dry end. Sampled 5/9/1999.

Huge lasting very creamy light brown head. Hazy brown body with a orange tan. Aroma of banana, bread, caramel, roasted malt, yeasty. Thin oily and a bit sticky texture. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Fresh finish.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2010 Bottle 500 ml.Brown color with very big lasting head. Aroma banana, bread, fruits.Taste bread,caramel, banana and short finish. Medium body. Good dunkel but not great.
Bottle at Paulaners im Spreebogen (Berlin). This time i like it more. Now i can say great dunkel.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown body topped by a dense, off-white head. Nose is mild nougat, taste is bread, hints of caramel. Nice, but a bit more bland and non-descript than my expectations had been, as their regular weizen is really good. A bit overrated in my opinion.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy oprange-brown colour, thick and foamy off-white head. Sweetish aroma of banana, apples and spices. The flavour is caramel-malty, lightly roasted, with yeast, plenty of banana and a little spicy aftertaste.

Cloudy, brown color, big white head; banana estery, fruity aroma with bready caramel notes; medium body, quite smooth, not too carbonated, but still crisp mouthfeel; flavor of toasted caramel and banana with bready notes and - though barely notable - spiciness.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden amber with a creamy off-white head that lasts a little while. Aroma has notes of banana, chocolate, yeast, caramel and spice. Flavour is less fruity, more spicy and a little sweeter, with the chocolate and caramel notes standing out. The body is a bit light with a thin, slightly watery mouthfeel, moderate carbonation and a dry, mildly sweet finish. Easy drinking, this is not a bad dunkel but far from the best.

Bottled, 2008-05-12, Göteborg
AP: brown body, big fluffy head. AR: Citrus and other fruity aromas. F: Citrus and other fruity aromas

Bottle.  Pours cloudy reddish brown with a big thick off-white head.  Aroma is of lots of sweet fruit (banana and apple, mostly), some musty yeast, and spice.  Plus some unpleasantness metallic notes.  Flavor is all of that plus some caramel malt and vanilla.  Flavor is actually very refreshing; palate is a bit watery; a little short in the back end.

Draught  Foxy-cream head over fully hazy orange-amber beer. Banana, jumble of fruity esters, sweet-sour, solvent. Sweet-sour, some wholemeal notes, and lots of fruit, mainly banana. Well-bodied, very (wheat)slick; long-lasting flavours. Nice, if unspectacular Dunkelweizen. Maybe thats tautology.

Draught in Berlin.
Brown-reddish, cloudy body, with a large, creamy, beige head, mostly lasting with a good lacing.
Fruity aroma (banana, apple; prune?) with some caramel notes due to the malt.
Moderate sweet flavour with a significant acidic character.
Medium body with an oily texture; average carbonation, some astringency in the finish.
Good, even if not as good as the helles one...

Bottled from Aachen. Dark nut brown color, vy, with huge tan foamy fluffy head. Even half emptied looks spectacular due to thick lacing it leaves. Aroma is citric with banana. Flavours is the same with more fruits. a very nice one!
500 ml, cloudy amber coloured with firm head, bit banana, vanila and some herbs.

A hazy dark amber ale with a thick light moka head. A rather bready and frutiy aroma, light bananas, with light gin alcohol notes. In mouth, roasted malt with light banana bread, yeasty, overall, a bit short in mouth. 500 mL bottle from Carrefour, Bogota, for 7000 COP (3.50$C), July 2009.

Bottled. Slightly yellowish brown and hazy beer. The head is huge, creamy and light beige in color. The aroma has sweet banana, some bubblegum, juicy wheat malts. Somewhat spicy and sour yeastiness. Slightly unpleasant, metallc backtaste. The flavor is malty, slightly bready and quite dry all the way. Sourish yeastiness in the finish with minor bitterness. The palate is medium bodied but slightly thin in the finish.  A bit sarp carbonation.
Bottle at home. Dark body with large head. Fruity nose, including bananas. Taste also of bananas and citrus. Nice and spicy with some caramel notes. A good dunkel.
50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy dark brown with ample tan head.  Aroma is banana and bread and a bit of citrus.  Flavor is banana and bread with some spiciness at the end.  Nice brew.
Smells great with a big foamy head. Banana mostly and some citrus. Little too hoppy for me, esp for a 0,5 liter bottle.

Muddy amber color with huge sized, mostly lasting, excellent lacing, creamy textured light brown head. Aroma of sweet bananas and vanilla. Delicate and balanced wheat beer character with slight toastiness and toffee feel. Light bodied, refreshing summer drink.

Draft sample. Hazy light amber on colour with medium carbonation. Berry fruit nose, along with vanilla, clove, and banana in the background. Sort of like Salvator-light in the mouth, with strong fruit notes upfront along with strong malts, and typical hefeweiss notes bringing up the rear. Medium bodied.

500 ml bottle. Finland (HHOK).
Murky brown colour with medium off-white head. Fruits (banana), bubblegum, caramel, vanilla and wheat in aroma. Flavour is sweetish, dark and wheaty.

Enjoyable but unremarkable.  Only moderate wheat and yeast nose.  Fantastic appearance, hazy and dark amber, with a fantastic "up your nose" head and fantastic lacing after the head quickly vanishes.  Taste of dark roasted wheat, which, actually, tastes like their hefeweiss, and some yeast.  Not much happening here.  No pepper, clove, banana, or any of the complexity I associate with a great wheat beer, none of the melon sweetness of a dark wheat.
500ml Bottle - Hazy brown in colour. Spicy and slightly fruity aroma, with raisins and banana. Fruity tastr with banana, dried fruit and some more fruity hints.

Unclear amber, some head - quite nice.

 Limited aroma.

 Nice and soft on the tongue, fizzy.

 Rounded, fresh, but the dunkel makes it more of a summer night than a summerday beer.

 Tasted at parents-in-law, KRK.
(bottle) pours a murky brown colour with a bubbly off-white head. aroma of wheat, banana and clove, nicely balanced. flavour is mostly wheat, lightly toasted. medium carbonation and body.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2009 Looks like mild orange choclate with whip cream on top - uniquely enticing. Nice roast malt, banana, slightly fruity and citrusy and, very subtle wood and nut aromas. This neat package hits your nose like a bouquet of roses will rock your lady. Smooth on the palate. Bubbly start, nice wheaty bitter middle and, baby sweet finish. Lop hops and accurate carbonation - this Dunkel is refreshing and pairs well with many foods  (bland or rich). Value for money. Tap please; not bottled. Oh yes ... there is a hint of creaminess to it.

Bottle 500ml. Rich creamy head, very cloudy light brown colour. Aroma has dark flavours and banana in it. Flavor is rich and balanced  with tastes of chocolate, roasted malt. Some carbonation, medium smooth aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours a hazy brown with creamy white head. Aroma is sweet of wheat, banana ester and a citrus nose. The flavour has wheat, caramel sweetness and fruit. Medium bodied. Smooth finish.
bottle 500 ml 3,01 from Alko EXP 04/2009 hazy amber huge white head  lacing sweet roasted malts banana spicy and yeast as well bit thin mouthfeel but tasty

...bottle. Poured a hazy brown with a tan head that was lasting, with lacing.  On the nose were roasted malt, fruits, yeast and wheat.  Flavors were roasted malts, wheat, yeast, fruit, with vanilla and clove notes.  Creamy, great flavors, with a lasting finish.  Not as good as thier regular hefe, but still a great beer, a must try.

Murky brown, lasting light beige head. Sligthly chocolatey aroma with apple and yeastiness. Spritzy wheaty flavor, little cocoa, apple, alcohol and even faint vanilla. Medium bodied mouthfeel with lively carbonation. Alright weizen, though a tad alcoholic.
Bottle. Pours an amber body with a white creamy head.  Zesty spices, wheat, coriander, banana, cloves and apple skins.  Good brew.

50cl bottle. It poured a hazy orange colour with a huge white creamy head that settled down slowly in the glass. The aroma is sweet with notes of wheats, yeast, banana and apples. The flavour is also sweet with notes of banana, wheats and yeast. It has a short, and a bit watery aftertaste.
Hazy deep amber with a huge off white head. Sweet yeasty aroma with roasthed malt, caramel and banan notes. Tsweet yeasty flavour with roasted malt, wheat and banana notes. Finished sweet.
Clear light brown bubbly with a good foamy beige head. Quite good and rich balanced hops and malts. Light but tasty.
Reddish hue with the usual banana and cloves over a nice shebert base. Beautiful balance and poise.  A nice beer.
From tap, Amber color malty than her weissbier sister, some spices and citrusy after taste, expected for more more from paulaner

Bottle from World of Beer, Clearwater, FL. 

Poured a cloudy dark brown with an average creamy off-white head that was lasting with good lacing. Moderate toasty malt, wheat and spice aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate sweet toasty malt flavor with a smooth sweet finish of an average duration.

Solid drinkable beer.

This is a beer to drink very slowly, to really enjoy it, no matter how much time it takes.
You have to pour into a glass and when you pour it, and left almost a finger to finish the bottle, shake it to disolve any sediment.
Its a refreshing taste that fills every beers fantasy

Im excited to see a large amount of sediment caked at the bottom of the bottle.  Upon pouring, the nose detects sweet cinnamon, apple, clove, and overall a malty banana nut bread scent. A tan, thick head, leaves a full wall on the glass when tipped to drink, and a light film of head covers the beer to the last drink. The flavor offers an initial strike of clove, then a slightly caramel sweet malty taste with hints of vanilla, and a light smooth cinnamon end. Nice, medium body with smooth texture.  The last few drinks contain a more intense creamy banana.  This is a great complex beer.

Superb appearance with a murky brown body and a stable beige head. Aromas of vanilla, roasted cocoa-beans, citruses, some classic wheat beer perfume like phenolic banana and fruity esters. Smooth mouthfeel, flavor of toffee, chocolate, caramel and some light lactic acidity. Complex body, pleasant aftertaste.

It’s kind of weird but I have had this (and the weiss) many many times and forgot to rate it ! 
Muddy amber brown color with huge foamy head.Malt and whaty aroma,classic banana and wheat  taste. Refreshing but rather boring. The weiss is a bit better but both are worst than the Weiehnstephaners.

Amber color with a large, quite creamy head with some lace. Initially strong banana-wheaty aroma with some roasted malt. Fades quickly, though. Medium-bodied palate with quite smooth, yet high carbonation. A light, easily drinkable, quite refreshing and balanced dunkelweizen.
Unclear dark amber, nice head. Strong aroma of dried fruit, some spices and toffee develops in mouth. Flavour is sweet and finish is sweet.

frothy, hazy, nice bitterness, full bodied, creamy thick head, soft carbonation, long lasting delicious finish.  I had this beer almost 10 years ago now, when I was underage in the US, but legal where I enjoyed it in Germany.  To this day it is the best taste that ever hit my lips, and to this day I cannot find it anywhere in the states, I am still staring at the empty can.

Cloudy, brown beer with beige and  velvet-like medium head. Wheat, yeast, some bananas and hint of toffee is found in the aroma. Flavour is typical weizen and there are also some roastiness and spicyness. Very pleasant to drink: smooth and oily and still medium carbonation. Great palate mix with bootilicious aromas and cause to sophisticated and succesfull beer.

50cl botle.
Pours cloudy brown with white head.
Aroma of grain, wheat and barley. Some sweetness.
Taste is very sweet (honey) and thick, lightly sugary. Grainy.
Very enjoyable, good Hefeweizen.

(Draught at Kaisla on 2008-08-16) Dark brown-orange colour. Cloudy. Fizzy quickly disappeared head. Banana and malts in nose. Medium-bodied palate with lot of carbonation. Banana, sweetness, light bitterness, caramell and fruitiness in taste.
Best Beer. Dark colored, great taste, wheat and fruit aroma. Very refreshing beer.

Bottled 50cl. It pours a surprisingly light colored beer. Dark orange. Much lighter in color than Maisels Weisse Dunkel for example. Fizzy fast diminishing head. The nose is of carrot accompanied by banana. Pleasant taste. Nicely balanced. Some cloves and nutmeg showing up. Poor lacework. Rather fruity (banana, berries, lemon). Dry finish. Nice and extremely refreshing.

Bottle @ home. A lot better than its regular weizen counterpart. Dark hazy brown, big head. Aroma of caramel, banana, spices, some laurel. Taste of banana, yeast, caramel/toffee, spice, laurel, roasted malts. Nice dry mouthfeel, rich flavours.
Thanks to ghawener.  Pours a dark brown with a good tan head.  Light bodied, good sweet taste, a bit more spicy than a regular Hefe.
Bottle: bready, nice complex heffe with sweet backnotes. Refreshing and full bodied. great session beer.
wow! nice mouth feel, full body. a little notes of chocolate and coffe with this weath dark beer! the aroma is "glamouroso!" the color dark invites me to take the second!

On tap at The Castle on KIng.  Beautiful golden body, thick foamy white head, so well presented in its own glass, this is an automatic 5.  Yeast, banana in aroma - subtle, soft.  Great taste - soft malt/wheat base, some clove and banana - nicely balanced.  Lots of clove in the finish.  Mouthfeel is just terrific - soft yet actively carbonated.  A really nice beer - like a refreshing easy to drink lower alcohol version of a Aventinus with the balance a little more tipped toward the wheat side of things.

Pours hazy brown with ample white head that dissipates gradually.  Mild malty estery (banana) aroma. Flavour of sweet malt, banana, woody clove. Very good , tasty and refreshing, but I prefer its light brother Paulaner Hefeweizen.

Munich import back home. Mahogany pour with muddy orange edges against the light and a collapsing collar of froth. Conditioning not the greatest for a hefe- head dissipates completely within swigs. Estery banana, clove and apple strudel aroma ripe with yeastiness, bubblegum and fruit. A dab of sweet cherry or plum/stone fruit, followed by watery red apple, the ubiquitous banana, woodsy spice and pepper. Underwhelming beyond the nose- the aroma suggests a bolder esteriness that doesnt really emerge. Was looking forward to this, and its a bit of an anticlimax. Still a pretty tasty beer, mind

Flaske. Mørkebrun rødlig øl. Tydelig banan duft, men den er ikke så kraftig i smagen, i det hele taget er smagen meget forsvindende, men dukker op til sidst med et diskret krydderbid. Ikke så meget andet at sige andet end hverken super eller dårlig.

0,5l bottle. Opaque brown. Theres a lot of wheat in the aroma and the same follows in the flavor. The flavor is a bit surprising since it doesnt really taste as dark as it looks. As a friend of hefeweissbier I liked it.

Nice aroma indeed, smells a bit belgian, add some egg and suger. hard to describe, but smells real good. muddy brown with small off-white foam, small bubbles. nice flavor, but a bit on the dull side. i can taste a little alc. which is a drawdown, not as refreshing as i had hoped for. Still a good beer. way above average. bit above average palate.
Hazy brown beer, 50CL bottle. THis beer is not bad. bud it isnt great. Fruity taste.

Murky oxide hue under a voluminous tan sponge.  Grape and cherry bubble gum collides with oily rye and caraway.  Soft acids and whole wheat cookies faint into a leafy finish.  Light, watery with a chalky texture; carbonation is brisk.
Shy acidity and malts leave me wanting.
50cl bottle, best before 10.2008.
Garrafa, 500 ml. Coloração marrom turva, com um bom creme bege. Notas de cravo, frutas, banana, fermento e torrefação. Paladar levemente amargo. Bom conjunto. Cerveja agradável e refrescante.

On tap at the Castle. Taps a brownish orange colour with a large beige head. Aroma of typical banana and clove, with a hint of spices and fruits. Flavour is really the same, with a decent malty aftertaste. Not as much bread flavour/character as I tend to look for. Extremely effervescent, the carbonation can quickly fill one up. Enjoyable, but I dont think this style is really "my thing", but I can tell its a well-made example of it, so Im still giving it a fair rating.
Pours a dark hazy brown color.  Aromas of bread, malt, and some fruit.  Flavor has a touch of sweet malt and clove, I think.  Overall, not to bad.

Long-lasting head is creamy. Color is hazy dark orange. Aroma is strong with banana, sweet malts and yeast. Flavor which contains much banana and a bit roastes malts is acidic. Palate is light-medium-bodied and carbonated. Maybe a bit watery in the end.
0,5l bottle. Nice nutty brown color with typical cream-like head. Aroma includes banana, wheat, flavor is dominated by malty sweetness and a certain metallic touch.

On tap.

Spicey malt aroma, with some fine wheat present too, hazy brown,  traces of gold  throughout, a tiny toffee head and some lovely lace. Flavour has a toasty caramel, malt start, a gorgeous wheat infusion, banana, nutty, plenty of spice also. Very well balanced, medium bodied, tongue tinglingly good, bitter towards the finish. Terrific! A real treat @ The Black Forest Restaurant in My hometown of Hamilton!

On tap at The Castle on King, in Kitchener, Ontario- Pours chestnut brown topped with a frothy beige cap. Nice lace. Yeasty, bubble gum nose with plum, lemons, banana, and wheat with clove. Quite tasty with fruity yeast, bubble gum and candy flavours, with rye bread and just a bit of spice towards the finish. Sweet, refreshing, satisfying Dunkelweizen.

Rated first time: 5.12.2006.
Bottle 500 ml, extract of wort about: >12,5%>
Very nice wheat and sweet Munich malt aroma, average for a dunkelweizen. Frothy head, cloudy and chestnut dark brown pinetree like in colour. A bit worse than the Hefeweizen counterpart. Yeasty, brown malty, and sweet. Mellow but also slightly accidic from its effervescence. Kind of intriguing, strange aftertaste (a bit flat though).
A hazy brown beer with a beige head. Aroma is wheat and banana, notes of yeast. Taste is roasted wheat and yeast. Sweet but refreshing.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown with a dense white head. Mild malty and wheaty/fruity aroma. Classic wheat flavour swept in a nice bed of caramel malt flavours which take out most of the banana and bubblegum notes. Ends with a mild malt lingering flavour.

Draught. Cloudy brown with a stable beige head. Aroma of wheat, banana, a bit of spices, some malt and hints of caramel. Flavor of wheat (and some wheat sourness) mixed with some malty sweetness - fruitiness, some toast and caramel. Light-bodied and refreshing. I like the regular Hefeweissbier a bit better but this one is quite nice as well.
Wirklich ein tolles Weissbier. Ich finde es noch besser als das Helle, absolut lecker. sehr süffig, gut bekömmlich, nicht übertrieben fruchtig. Immer wieder gern.

Draught, muddy reddish caramel brown colour. strong aroma of bubblegum with a strong yeasty and some cooca notes behind it. Sweet with a presence of banana and nutmeg spiciness. smooth, creamy and easy to drink.

Had this beer on 8/3/2000.  Aroma is a lot like Paulaners Hefe-Weizen with a slightly roasted scent in there.  Color is a deep hazy brown with very good carbonation and too much head.  Taste creamy and sweet.  Starting with a rich body  that goes down smooth with a gentle sweet banana flavor.  Finish is a creamy feel with very light roasted and sweet malt flavor backed by a faint coriander and banana taste.  Overall its a very complex beer.  A lot like there regular Hefe but a bit rich, I think it would be just a little better if it where a little more crisp rather then creamy.

0.5 l bottle. Poured murky amber to orange-brownish colored body with quite big brownish head. Much brighter than Ive expected. Nice weizen aroma, not too strong though, banana, clove, nothing special. Flavor is very pleasant, fruity, quite full bodied with moderate sweet finish, but still it misses something. Maybe because bit of cardboard inside. Expected much more again, so quite disappointed but objectively a good beer.
Hazy, mahogany brown colour. Sweet roasted malty taste. Medium bodied mouthfeel with a smooth carbonation.
0,5 l bottle. Hazy amber color, small, cremay beige head. Fruity (banana), citric - easy drinking weissbeer.

I wouldhave bet I already rated this but for some reason it seems not, and ony thanks I checked it after I saw it in a store close to here. It was creamy but soft, not to god but with its wheat taste.

on tap at the Castle very fresh sample;

Taps a clouded amber ( much like Schneider original) with a decent 2 finger sticky meringue cap that laces the glass as it drains.

Aromas are well defined big banana, peach and clove with some malty sweetness..very pungent.

Great wheat malt spine, fruity-spicey character medioum body with more substantial mouth feel than their pale hefeweizen.

Starts semi-sweat with a honey and fresh biscuit discernment then the great fruit and spice tastes arrive to make a more complex mixture on the palate. Fishes semi-dry with a spicey biscuit after taste.

A top tier commercial hefeweizen
Hazy brown colour with large white head.Taste of peach and banana.Flavor of rosted wheat still mild and fresh.
Dark brown, hazy with a nice, huge head. Very typical for a dunkel weiss with slight sweetness, notes of caramel, wheat, banana - and its nicely balanced.

Bottle. Very dark Amber color, nice beige cream, Aroma with notes of Banana, citric ans some fruity, some roasted malt too. Flavor is softy and a little bit sweety. Mouthfeel is good but low bitterness.. Good one!

Cerveja de cor Âmbar turva, boa espuma bege, aroma com notas de banana e frutado, um toque de malte torrado também. Sabor leve e um pouco adocicado. Retrogosto agradável porém com baixo amargor....

(Bottle) Pours dark, hazy copper red. Fruity banana aroma with tones of clove and flowers up front but also some perfume and incense. Also some hints of apple tobacco. Rather massive aroma for the style. Wheat flavour with tones of banana and yeast. Some spicy and floral notes in the flavour as well. A bit grassy. Creamy mouthfeel with a medium body.

Pours a hazy honey gold.  Soapy head dissipates quickly.  Smells fruity with clove.  Cozy aroma.  Whaaty, bready taste, consistent mouthfeel due to low carbonation.  Uninteresting aftertaste dominated by clove.  Not a beer to drink more than one bottle, gets rather nauseating but good nonetheless.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2008 500ml bottle. (rerate - identical)
Dark hazy orange, large doughy head. Floral and light aroma, caramel, and some hops too. Sweet fruity and spicy taste, bready maltiness for a reasonable full body. Refreshing, less sticky and sweet than some dunkel hefeweizens. Hop presence is slightly metallic, but not unpleasantly so.
Tap at the Biergarten, Munich 0,5ltr: Hazy brown coloured with almost the same taste as the weizen only this one is roasted.
dark amber light brown coloured body with a smal white head a sweet fruity aroma a little yeasty sweet taste and a sweet malty finich
Bottle 0,5l at Viktualienmarkt München 18 Jun 07. A large creamy off-white head. Colden coloured. Unclear. Aroma of citrus. Roasted fruity flavor. Sweet aftertaste of citrus.

Bottle:Hazy red colour,creamy head.
Aroma of banan,citrus,fruity, and a seet maltynes.
Flavor is almost the same, but the hops is more caracteristic here,. Thin to medium body, short  to medium finish.

(Bottle BBE 04/2008) Slightly roasted, fruity (banana) and wheat aroma. Orange red colour, murky (sedimentation in the bottle) and average size, white head with fair lacing. Slightly roasted, fruity (banana), acidic, wheat, sweet and bubble-gum flavour. Lively carbonated, medium-bodied and slightly sticky flavour. 28/06/07

A bit of banana sweetness on the nose, which I could live without. Otherwise quite easy and drinkable dunkelweizen. Nothing really distracting other than the banana flavor, but you get that with almost all weizens. Good, but nothing to remember.
Fruity,malty, wheat. Amber with solid head. Fresh light sweet taste of malts. Good dunkelweizen!

a nice hefe. typical full bodied german that is refreshing and tasty. the flavors of banana and clove are there in proper measure. and a more than adequate and quality sweetness has been inbedded to satisfy. nut bready and substantial, this has an appropriate carbonation to make it smooth and almost chewy.

From bottle. Hazy dark amber body with a niche foamy head. Nose is ripe banana with some hints of clove. Banana and caramel in mouth, with a yeasty finish. Light carbonation makes it heavier than the hefeweizen, which is appropriate for a dunkel, still it is quite refreshing.  On the par with the other products from this bavarian brewer.

Berlin Trip beer No.16. Bottle. Couldnt find it on tap, so had a bottle with a meal. Yellow/brownish body. Small yellowish head. Bananas, some malty sweetness. Not much in the way of spices. It has a slightly medicinal flavour. Short finish. I was a bit let down by this as Im a big fan of their weizen hell.

Bottle.  Murky brown amber with a good head.  A little malt and obviously some banana in the nose.  Tastes unexceptional but solid still with banana and clove at the tail end.  Easy on the mouth.  This is my watermark for a dunkelweizen.

Pours a mahogany color with a ton of head. Not sure if someone shook this bottle all the way from Germany to Panama, it seems like it. Not the best style for the tropics, but for the style seems right on. The bananay esters are there, just like the Paulaner hefe blonde, but with extra malty, honey, almost butterscotch notes.  Not cloying, and good long finish for the style. Never seen this before in Panama, and not sure I will ever again.

Bottle. Pours dark amber, nice off white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel malts and slight bubblegum. Wheaty flavor with toffe notes. Smooth, biscuity. Solid brew. How this ranks only in the upper 70s overall is beyond me. This is an excellent  beer.

Bottle, 50 cl. Cloudy amber, large but quickly disappearing fluffy off-white head. Toffeish and fruity malt aroma, some clove and banana in the background. Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Very refreshing flavour, some light sweetness, some acidity, and some bitterness.
Muddy darkbrown with wonderful fat head. Aroma of hospital, banana and wheat-yeast. Sweet flavor with similar notes and also bread. Great wheat beer!
At Frankfurt airport. A quite fine dark hefe, though I find the apperance of the these beers a bit weird and muddy. fine and soft, some banana flavour and proper wheat malt taste.
Dark brown colored pour with huge creamy head.  Sweet, spicy with a nice malty, yeasty finish.

Tasted 2007-03-29. Fresh bottle, 50cl. Dark, hazy, brown colour. Looks a bit like a cola, thats been sitting out for a while. Actually looks kinda good! Yeasty aroma. A little acidic. Notes of banana. Ditto taste! I like it!
Bottle.  Pours dark tan.  Aroma is malt.  Taste is very sweet but not too much so.  A good dunkelweisse.

A hazy, dark copper brown coloured beer with a thick and frothy head. A strong, wheaty aroma with a little bana and a touch of spice. A dry taste, wheaty with a hint of malt to start, then a slightly sour, fruity flavour with clove spice that lasts to a dry finish. (Bottle - purchased from Beers of Europe, Setchey, Norfolk for £1.95 a bottle).

Bottle. Murky dark amber colour with rather creamy off-white head of medium duration. Roated malt and dried fruits in the aroma. Slightly sweet malt and some yeast in the flavor. Average finish with a little fruit-sweetness. Not one of the best dunkelweizen.

Vom fass @ Frankfurt International Airport, Frankfurt-am-Main, Germany (July 2006).
Last Mercedes Benz E class taxi my wife and I would take, or see, and the last beer I would try before leaving sehr schön Deutschland for home. It came in its own tall glass, enthralled with charging effervescence, a tawny, opaque, caramel coloured elixir toppled on by a very excited, ever expanding head of fluff that did its best to escape. Conversation beyond the beer turned to a lovely lass from Sydney about to head to Lebanon to see her family. The beer now background, it smelt of soggy chocolate biscuits entwined with cloves, used band-aids and fresh, ripe bananas. Prickly, from the bubbles, it pierced the nostrils last thought. Tasted of carbonic acid, too fizzy chilled and fresh, some conversation later it got better. A little doughy, cookie dough and tangy wheat, a lemony sour, tangy backdrop as it hurtles down the sides, the subtle, clappy swallow has the ripe banana, subtle bubblegum mix of a good hefe-weiss with a flowing biscuity swallow that lasts and works. It holds just a light edge of woody reserve to make each mouthful after the first a little better, a little more enticing. Lost in converse I must say that I fell away while tasting this which made it more pleasurable. A sessionable, simple Dunkel weiss that ranked up with pub greats. Good with the mind off!!!

It is a superior Lager, does not have doubt Color dark amber, dense and persistent cream. Very good combination between the Weiss, of wheat, and the Dunkel, of toasted malt. And, in the palate, the impression is exactly this. The characteristic fruit one of the Weiss is broken up perfectly of the taste of toasted malt of the Dunkel. Well interesting, it deserves to be appreciated....................................... É uma Lager superior, não há dúvida...
Cor âmbar escuro, creme denso e persistente.
Combinação muito boa entre a Weiss, de trigo, e a Dunkel, de malte torrado. E, no paladar, a impressão é justamente essa. O frutado característico das Weiss separa-se perfeitamente do gosto de malte torrado da Dunkel.
Bem interessante, merece ser apreciada.

Bottle. Hazy orange/amber colour with a bigt creamy off-white head leaving a good lacing. Good wheat aroma, sweet with roasted malts. The flavour is sweet and yeasty, fruity banana,  a good roasty maltiness, slightly smoky.  A bit too sweet for my taste buds but a good dark wheat brew.

Ótima cerveja escura de trigo. Concorrente direto da cerveja Erdinger, a Paulander não fica atrás em nada. coloração caramelo escura, espuma encorpada e sempre presente, um leve sabor adocicado, sem grande presença. Cerveja encopada, gostosa de beber.
I like dunkels but this was a bit below quality. brown and slightly hazy and fairly flat. Quite powerful wheat presence which is probably what put me off.Not one I would try again,

Big, solid, lasting beige head. Nearly translucent brown Mouth-watering aroma of quality yeast and malt. Beer is lighter than expected, even for a hefe, a little watery even. Flavors are not too complex. Malt, a little sweet caramel, some bananna. Not a bad beer, but it seems to be lacking in character compared to other dunkelweizens I have tried.

Purchased in Germany. 500ml bottle with a 02.07 best by date on it.

Pours a very cloudy dark brown with some hints of amber. The head is two fingers tall, and fades slowly to a to thick cap, leaving behind a solid sheet of foam in the glass.

Smell; this has a solid wheat aroma, with a little clove and bananas. Theres a very nice caramel malt presence as well. Pretty much what I would expect in a Dunkel Weizen, but not really outstanding.

Taste; bananas and cloves are present in the flavor along with the wheat and caramel malts. This follows the aroma, but with a hint of bubblegum, and the other flavors are a bit more pronounced than the aroma was.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a very smooth carbonation, and the drinkability is really good. I would have no problem enjoying more than one of these in a night.
