text:
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2007 <50cl bottle on Egmont>
Dark shady amber/brown appearance with a long lasting white/tan head. Notes of roasted malt and floral lime hobs. The balance betwenn malt, hobs and wheat is well done, and the lively carbonation works well in this beer. Overall really enjoyable!

Bottle. Muddy brown with a tone towards orange. Little creamy head that stays all the way through the hefe glass. Aroma i sweet with some roasted tones, some oranges, lots of bananas. Taste as well is fine - one of the best hefe dunkels.

Bottle. First impression was that it wasnt quit as dark in colour as expected. The hue is more brownish with a muddy look. Particles are large. Head is average, creamy white with fair lacing which was mostly lasting. Aroma is very nice with notes of coriander, grapefruit, orange, some perfume, banana, caramel maybe even some bubblegum in there as well. Very refreshing and reasonable complex sniff. If sniffed hard, some acidity can also be detected. Palate were medium bodied with a sparkling texture and very fizzy carbonation that gave the sparkling feel. Initial flavour was moderated sweet with light acidity to it. Not much bitterness to detect here. Finish is again sweet and slightly acidity.
Bottled. Brown beer with a very big foam. Estery and wheat aroma. Ver sweet and wheaty, surely too much for me, but not totally bad.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2007 very nice wheat aroma, avarage for a dunkelweisen forth, cloud and chestnut dark brown pinetree colour. mild, worse than its light brother. yeasty and sweet(ie).but beautiful, strange aftertaste

A slightly vineous aroma, with a brilliant banana and yeast aroma, and a little bit of wheat. The flavor is very banana-like and yeasty too, but now the hops and the typical sourish weissbier tones are more obvious than in the aroma. However, these tones are not distinct, and leaves us therefore with a mild, sweet and well-balanced weissbier. It has a good palate and is very creamy. Not the ultimate weissbier, but very good and a must try.
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a huge beige head. Aroma and flavour pf raosted malt and hops.
bottle. murky light brown color. large head. clear aroma of bananas. bit more roasted than the hefe. otherwise the same.

(50 cl bottle at a pub close to the Dom in Köln) Cloudy brown color, fluffy tan head. Banana wheat scent, also a bit of metal. Typical wheat beer banana taste. Fruity aftertaste. Thin, but also spritzy, mouthfeel. Medium bitterness.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 8 Oct) Dark  amber colour with huge, lasting off-white head. Fruity, sourish nose with dark fruit, banana and plums. Fruity, citrussy taste with a sweetish wheat character, chocolate and banana (like chocolate/banana ice cream). Enjoyable but not the most exciting dunkelweizen.

Dark brown and cloudy, with a foamy white, long lasting head. Aroma is banana and cloves. Flavour is the same plus malt and yeast. Very smooth, extremely drinkable with a very good mouthfeel. Excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2007 This company is everything I love about beer.  Pours an off orange, slightly brown. Nice tan full head. Citrusy /bannana taste with the right mix of carbonation.

Awesome beer
(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy brown body with a large off-white head.  Aroma of wheat, mustiness, light fruit, and caramel.  Flavor of malt, fruit, and toffee.

Draught at 20.Karlovački Dani Piva, Karlovac, Croatia. This years novelty on K.D.P was Bavarian tent with Paulaner beers (Hefeweissbier, Hefeweissbier Dunkel and Oktoberfestbier). Pours a hazy dark brown with a nice medium size creamy head. Aroma is wheaty and very fruity (banana, lemon, orange, clove) with nice spicy notes. Tasty and refreshing. Probably the best beer ever on K.D.P.
Bottle. Dark brown cloudy body with a creamy wheat head. Aroma of banana and spicy clove. Smooth body, creamy, filling.

Bottle from Munich train station. Pours light brown with a big fluffy off-white head. Aroma of clove, toffee, and caramel. Tastes same as aroma. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lush, creamy carbonation. A very nice dunkelweizen, but not top-notch.

Bottle.Pours a cloudy light amber with a nice foamy head.Aromas of sweet roasted barley,citrus ,dried fruits,banana,yeast and hops.Flavors of dried fruit,banana,spices,yeast  and hops are present.A good brew.
Heavy hoppy aroma. Huge creamy off-white head. Cloudy brown body. Heavy initial flavor. Medium palate.

an aroma of over-ripe summer fruits - mostly apples - warmed in the sun. Chesnut and highlights of tangerine. 
Suggestions of cloudiness, the drawing in of the olips to the late toffee sweetness calling for something sharp--of fine sharp mature English cheddar will be delicious -

500ml bottle: poured orange brown with a nice sized beige head that remained throughout. Moderate banana and clove aroma. Flavor is moderately sweet int he finish with a decent amount of yeast presenta and banana. Full body. A nice beer.

A good, no-nonsense dunkelweizen with ripe melons in richer, slightly darker tones than a normal weiss. Finish is rather thin, I should have liked a bit more staying power there. Not bad, but for my dark weizen cravings I will stick with Aventinus (draft -- bottled it barely realizes half its potential).

Bottle.
Hazy orange coloured with an off white head.
Aroma of fruits and bananas.
Flavour of fruits and bananas.
Bottled. Hazy amber-brown color. Sweet, malty, caramelly and yeasty aroma with rye and clove. Sweetish, bready and caramelly flavor with clove and banana. A flat finish.

Huge offwhite creamy head with holes after large bubbles. Body is opaque dark brown with hazy yellowish brown edges. Sweetish citric wheaty aroma with notes of coca-cola and a mix of licorice and earth. Traces of banana, too. Light, bananaish bubblegum taste, slightly tart and watery. A decent dunkelweizen, but a bit too watery and bland. (0.5l bottle.)

(on bottle) Brown and hazy, steady white head. Soft banaa sent, notes of bread and even some toast in there. Foamy, whiped cream mouth + waterish. The banana stays for the finish and gets slightly bitter. Burby, but interestin with the toasting in a weiss mit hefes.

Bottle: Hazy, chestnut coloured, lacing, nearly white head; sweet-fruity nose (ripe - maybe exotic fruit - , berries) the "normal" bananas and cloves are rar away....., some caramelly notes detectable; moderate sweet flavour; sweet dark-malt, caramel and a light bitterness in the sweet, mainly fruity finish. A very well rounded Weizen without too many edges......
Hazy, brownish with very big, cloudy lasting head. Mils taste with slight caramel notes, very rich and almost creamy as for a dunkelweizen. Reasonable carbonation. Great one.

Bottle from Munich.  Lovely hazy bronze to caramel brown in color with whipped tan fluff riding a third of an inch high and retaining well for the head.  Aroma takes an original route: allspice, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg and chocolate bananas with caramel and ginger drizzles.  A subtle vanilla and white chocolate toffee bark element comes in on the backend.  Flavor is a light flight.  Loose caramel and cloves get a little help from ginger root and dried banana shavings.  Light spiced bread aided and abetted with cinnamon, nutmeg and brown sugared spice drops.  At times, were sucking on grandpas seltzer with both flavor and mouth feel.  Light bodied with a lightly spiced tongue titillation at times.  Scaled back balance on all accords, finishing with spiced grahams, light chocolate cocoa powder, spiced gingerbread and a big swig of soda water held in the mouth (simultaneously) bring us to a somewhat disquieting finish.

This beer seems to be everywhere but deserves to be.  It is good.  Poured a dark orange with cloudiness.  Big tan head.  Good nose of malts and fruit.  Some spices there too. Good smooth, almost oily mouthfeel.  Goes down like syrup.  This was very nice.

Cask at the Bastion in Russia.  Poured a hazy dark mohogany with a creamy white head.  Aroma of sweet caramel, banana, clove, and cinnamon.  Flavor is lightly sweet cinnamon, banana, clove, grassy hops... good mix of sweet and dry.  Very nice.

Bottle, at Benny.
Dark orange with a large beige head, mostly lasting, good lacings. Aroma moderate malty, light yeasty. Flavor moderate sweet and light acidic. Light/medium body, oily, soft carbonated.
Bottle. Nice big tan head with good duratioin. Color is brown. Aroma is sweet and malty. Some spices as well. Taste is wheat and spices.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2007 Strong aroma of flowers, banana and chocolate toffee. The colour is changing througout the class, from dark honey to mahogany. Very sweet taste, the flavors dancing around without finding a place to sit. A bit clinical, medicinal aftertaste. The body is healthy, the beer average as a total.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown-copper with a large fluffy off-white head. The aroma largely consists of pepper spices and banana...amongst bubble gum. Super smooth, creamy body with only little carbonation. Flavours of banana fruits, clove,  overtop a slight toastiness. May be a bit watery in the finish. Pretty solid otherwise.
Bottle. Hazy amber coloured with medium off-white head. Sweet. Slightly sour and friuty. Maybe citrus and plums.
UPDATED: APR 2, 2008 Cloudy dark golden, with a short lived, bubbly head. Banana and caramel aroma. Sweet banana-dominated flavour with some acidity and spice.
Dark color, (cloudy) thin head,..nice tipical paulaner tast with some extra spicy parts,..natural ingredients,..very good weisse.

300ml vom fass - outside seating at Zum Paulaner in Stuttgart. Hazy brown. Medium lasting foam. Characteristic weisse aromas of wheat and banana. Sweetness flavour with banana and clove. Rather dry finish. Alright, but a bit too sweet for my taste (22.04.2006).
[bottle from magic_dave6] Nose of esters and sweet roasty malt. full bodied dry finish.

500ml bottle	Hazy lt brown w/ gold overtones. . . .	Banana, cloves, hints of roast malt. . 	Sweet, malty.  Very minor roastiness. .  .	Medium / light.  Coating.. . .. .. 	Not too far from Paulaner helles hefeweissbier.  More good stuff from Paulaner.
Bottle. Pours murky orange/brown with a two finger thick beige head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, and caramel. Flavor is wheat, bananas, caramel, smooth, and sweet. Good healthy body, good brew.
Rather ugly brownish color (could have been the light) but with a great head. Sweet normal weizen and not one of my favorites.

mmm...i am drinking this right now in the lovely town of Essen, Deutschland. its a beautiful dark amber with nice little swirls of yeast in it. and of course, i poured it correctly. the head is sizeable and fairly white. it smells of ripe fruit and cloves, with some malt and grassyness in there. taste is similar, with LOTS of cloves, cinnamon, and banana, yum.
Bottled. Red brown with a beige head.Aroma is banana and caramel. The flavour has caramel with a hint of banana.
Dark coloured brew. Nice light, fresh beer. A bit sweet and a bit fruity. Nice finish.
Dark brown with light brown head. Sweet malt smell. Rich full flavored dark malt.
Bottle. White lasting head. Unclear orange body. Weak banana aroma. Caramel flavor. Not tasty enough, sorry.

Bottled.  Cloudy chestnut pour with an off-white head.  Smells like the "normal" Paulaner Hefe, perhaps a bit sweeter.  Also tastes like the "normal" Paulaner but with a shot of malt complexity.  Cant say this is necessary.  Still, a good choice - delicious.
Dark amber colour, light brown, small white head. Sweet aomra, fruity, some banana? Little yeasty. Sweet taste, again some banana, finish is sweet malty.
A good dunkel weissbier on this evening of december 31 in 2005.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2008 Bottled. Amber, with a huge white head. Aroma is sweet and banana. Flavor has some spices to it too. Quite sweet on the palate. Nice, but not world-class. Rating: 5-4-6-3-14-3.2. (051209)Bottled. Hazy, amber with a huge off-white head.Aroma is banana, caramel-sweetness, coriander and yeast. The flavor has caramel and butterscotch. Light fizzy and sweet body with a dry finish coming stronger towards the very end. (060225)

500ml bottle, from Beers of Europe. (BBE 30 November 2005, drunk October 2005). I cant say this did a great deal for me. But I must admit that I do generally find German dark beers a touch uninspiring. I think I expect the darker colour to contribute a fuller body and greater depth of flavour than their paler equivalents, but often the difference is marginal. In fact its not very dark, but an attractive coppery colour with a lasting white head. The aroma is wheaty (not surprisingly) with more lemon than banana and I thought I picked up a slightly smoky edge. Lemon carries through on to the palate. Quite sharp with a tinny edge. Thinnish mouthfeel. OK, but nothing special. Perhaps a bit long in the tooth.

Bottle. Cloudy brown colour. Long lasting off-white head. Cloves and hints of bananas in the aroma. Smooth flavour of cloves and bananas. Some sweet caramel taste aswell. Smooth aftertaste of cloves bananas and yeast.

Bottled.
Cloudy broen, large off-white head.
Herby and spicy aroma and flavour with notes of banana.
Pours muddy brown with a thick, frothy, white head. Wheat, clove nose with some hints of cellar. Sweet, slight acidic flavour with some spicy and sugary notes. Somewhat yeasty finish. Medium bodied.

Muddy orange-brown color, a lot fine bubbly and hazy. Extremely creamy and abundant foam, optimal adhesion and duration. Determined and pleasant scent of wine cellar and clear mildews, to read toasted and aged malty notes. Balanced taste, little bitter, with notes of vanilla and banana on the end. Pleasant and of long persistence final.
Cloudy brown body with a medium long lasting head. Smells of vanilla, spices, malt & yeast. Tastes very smoky and malty. a bit too sweet
Keg at Porterhouse, Covent Garden. Dark gold hazy thich beige head. Bubblegum nose some banana. Bit of toffee malt. Finish is very dry with more bubblegum

(Bottled, BBE 08/2006) Opaque, muddy dark orange/amber color with a large, quite creamy head with some lace. Initially strong banana-wheaty aroma with some roasted malt. Fades quickly, though. Sweetish, fruity-estery banana flavor with well-balanced roasty maltiness, some smoke and acidity. Medium-bodied palate with quite smooth, yet high carbonation. A light, easily drinkable, quite refreshing and balanced dunkelweizen.

Bottled (BB 08/2006)
Dark hazy nut brown, huge tanned foamy head. Banana aroma is dominating. Medium-bodied. Clean, fruity, caramelly,  banana flavors with smokeyness in the finish. Smokey roasted and a bit alcoholic aftertaste. Very refreshing and excellent dunkelweizen.

Cloudy cocoa-water brown w/ small off-white head.
Smells of vanilla, candy banana, smoky, spicy, malt & yeast.
Tastes a bit metallic, some malt, fizzy and fluffy.
Hazy amber/orange, nice offwhite head. Smoky aroma with malt and some woodyand roasted notes. Flavor is fruity, wheat and yeast and with smoky notes that keeps following the beer into the finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, reddish amber colour with a big off-white head. Sweetish, yeasty aroma with malty notes. Sweetish, slightly fruity, flavour with notes of yeast. slightly sour finish with faint spicy notes. Soft palate.

Bottled. 
Cloudy brown colour with a light brown head, it all looks creamy and yummy. Aroma is light toasty notes from malt and rich estery. Mouthfeel is big on C02, and there are notes of overripe apples. Light sourish and refreshing, still bit toasty. Pretty light mouthfeel. Id wish for a heartier body.

Unclera brown with a huge tan foam. Big estery banana aroma, hints of pear, light chocolate and caramel. Cloves and banana in flavour with a soft background of light chocolate. Cloves and banana in the aftertaste with roasty undertone. Smooth palate. Nice.

500 ml bottle, bought in Germany. Pours cloudy brown with an enormous offwhite head. Intense banana aroma with notes of caramel, toffee, chocolate and cloves. Refreshing hefe-weissbier flavour, with some extra notes of malts and dark bread, but light-bodied - if blindfolded, I might mistake the flavour for a pale hefe.  I wouldnt mind having this beer as one of my "regulars".
Orangebrown coloured beer with a very large creamy head. Big banana-malts aroma, maybe evensome orangefruit. Sweet taste, fruity, ending in a soft bitterness. Decent Dunkelweizen.

Fresh, smooth, not very complex, just roast and chocolate malt aroma and chocolate malttaste. Medium satisfying mouthfeel, great after Sushi with wasabi and ginger. Pure brown, lace. Dry aftertaste. Some malt, banana and citrus, bit of yeast. Well carbonated. Thanks Mark for bringing back from germany.

Fully lasting creamy head, wonderfull dark orange colour.
Powerfull wheat aroma, and typical flavour, A nice hefe beer.
Dunkel color and beautiful carbonation. Great head. (Naturally). Flavor is rich, honey, wheat but way too thin in the palate. Otherwise excellent.
Draught. Nut brown colour, small foamy head. Sweet plummy raisin aroma. Bitterish plummy flavour with hints of raisins. Kind of watery and bitterness is a bit too strong in my opinion.

50 cl Bottle. Brown colour, with a nice little too fast head. Good aroma of bread and some fruit. Good taste of wheat and malt, and some hint of roasted barley and tittle sour aftertaste. A good dunkel but not at all the best in this dark category. I Prefer Paulaner hefe-weizen.

From the local grocery store.  For a Hefe-Dunkel this is an all over decent beer.  Nice cloudy tea color.  Forms a nice head, but must be poured into a Hefe glass for the full effect.  Sure beats Coors.

(Bottle 50 cl) If appearance was everything this beer would be in trouble - serious trouble: greyish brown, hazy or rather muddy - Chinese river-water. Malty and soft with a gigantic head. But less fresh, fruity and citrusy than the typical Hefeweizen. 190100

(bottle) Murky brown colour with a medium foamy and slightly off-white head. Malty aroma with a fruity banana note. Slight roastmalty taste with a note of caramel and a smooth but quite short finish with some hints of clove.

pours a hazy red/brown beer with a big biege head. aroma: banana, cloves, yeast. taste: sourish, banana. palate is a bit too watery, peppery. finish is sourish, banana-taste lingers on. carbonation is good, but this is gone in just a few minutes(used an original glass!). good example of this style.

Orange hazy, off-white tall, lasting head. Good carbonation.
Somewhat sourish aroma. Wheat. Yeast. Mild, fresh flavour. More wheat, some malty sweetness. Banana. Faintly metallic. Watery palate.

1 pt. .9 fl oz bottle - Albertsons, Baton Rouge, La. Pours a murky, medium golden with a tight white head, decent lacing. Sweet aroma of banana, cloves and molasses. Flavor has some candied sugar notes, bubble gum, maple syrup with a back end of banana. Some yeasty, bready notes in there as well. Mouthfeel is thick and somewhat sticky. Very decent, one of those I thought I had always had but for some reason the bottle just looked different to me here in Baton Rouge.

From A Bottle.Reddish cloudy brown in colour with a large head,
aroma is of wheat and banana,taste is smooth with banana,
bread,yeast and fudge,light sweet finish,the more I drank the better it got.
Pours a nice amber with a very generous dense head.  Smell is of bananas, oranges and grapefruit.  Taste is citrussy with some choclatey aftertaste.  Very nice and very surprising.

Brought by a friend from Germany instead of the Salvator I ordered. I guess I got a better deal. What suprised me about this one is how similar it looked to a regular hefe. Same unfiltered apricot colour, maybe a bit darker hue. Anyway, strong banana aroma, big, rapidly disappearing white head.  Sweet taste, bananas, a touch of lemon,  and very, very lightly roasty. Not sure if its better than my favorite (Franziskaner Hefe), but its close.
Pours a cloudy brown color with big head.  Wheat-banana aroma.  Flavor not as big on the wheat as some others.  I prefer more wheat in this style.  Smooth, but seems to be missing something.

very cloudy, obvious caramel hint, heavily malty. This is actually a very nice dunkel but very very heavy ... floral nose, some bananas, caramel like I mentioned earlier, not something to gulp in a few sips
Cloudy brown colour with large off white head. Aroma has a wheaty sweetness and hints of banana and caramel. Flavor is malty with sweetness from caramel and banana. Nice thick palate.

brown and cloudy with a large head when initially poured.  Aromas are caramel, toffee malts with nice fruitiness - bananas and lemon.  Flavours are malty and slightly smoky.  Yeast, cloves and bananas in there, too, along with a surprising citrus zestiness that livens the beer up.  Another good Paulaner.

Pint bottle poured into tall glass. Bremen, Germany. First round the barperson added lemons. hmm, well without lemons...poured light brown-gold with a nice fluffy head and great lacing. very very smooth, drinkable beer in my opinion. I REALLY ENJOED IT. nice smooth palate. Aroma is of bananas and toffe. Taste is the same with some added fruits and brown sugar. very well balanced. I need to stock this at home for the less complex nights. ßßß
Pleasant yeasty flavour, not so much fruit as the other Paulaner weizen. Easy drinking and very quenching.
Long off-white lasting head, brown body, sweet aroma. The flavour is rather sweet but well-balanced, with a hint of fruits. A very well-made summer beer Id say.

Pours turbid brown with medium off-white head.  Aroma of malt, toffee, hopcit, some banana, and cognac.  Nice complexity and balance, with a fruity, citrusy, toffee finish.  Very well made, as are all Paulalner beers, as far as Im concerned.
Beautiful foam that lasts. Well balanced medium bodied however a little dull in the aftertaste.

Dark sour malty aroma with yeasty banana-clove esters. Dark cloudy brown with thin off-white head. Medium bodied with medium-high carbonation. Malty sweet start, with banana and clove. Low acidity and mild bitterness. Rather dull overall but pleasant. Sweet cereal finish and after.
Dark red-brown color, light sweet caramel malty aroma, light fruity roasted taste, medium body, light dry finish.
500ml bottle. Murky, sweet and weaky, slightly watery and with definate smoked character.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2009 Wheaty beer with a reddish amber color.  Had a yeasty taste with extra maltiness. Lots of different flavors and complexity.  Full foamy head, long lasting of course.  Mild finish.  A very well-made beer. (Had in a Paulaner Pub in Kiel, Germany)
Bottle.  Malt and banana aroma.  Cloudy brown color.  Moderate hops bitterness with light malt flavor with only a hint of fruit.  Not bad but pretty light for the style.
Very nice and drinkable dunkel.  Fruity type aroma and almost overly sweet tongue, but the taste is quite nice.  Im softening on these dunkel things.  Dunkel dunkel dunkel.

Lovely cloudy red-brown colour. Lacey, quickly diminishing head. Heavy banana aroma. The taste is somewhat out of style in that it tastes like a Helles Hefeweizen minus the citric taste. Smooth texture. Some fruitiness and some hints of coffee and caramel. Ok, maybe some more differences to a helles weizen. But very drinkable and I think even better than its Franziskaner equivalent.
Murky brown colour. Nice head. Big banana-aroma with sourish clove-fumes. Yeast-dry flavour with liquorice and sourish cloves (again). Very smooth and drinkable.

This pours a typical dark brown cloudy body with a huge creamy wheat head. Aroma of banana and spicy clove. Smooth body, creamy, filling.
I imagine this would rate even higher if sampled fresh (which these German Weizens rarely are here in the U.S.)

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark brown and cloudy, with a foamy white, long lasting head. Aroma is banana and cloves. Flavour is the same plus malt and yeast. Very smooth, extremely drinkable with a very good mouthfeel. Excellent.
mediocre flavor of cake, oil, and some other descriptive adjective which seems to have slipped my fragile, fragile mind at the moment.  pardon me for not writing this rating down.
Dark and unclear. Medium head. Fruity and spicy, corianer. A bit too sour. Perhaps to old.

Cloudy copperish color with small head. Very fruity and banana aroma, some yeast in there too. Strong banana flavor is pretty dominating, no hops to mention. Some yeastiness also in flavor, but somehow it fits in nicely. Carbonation comes up in the end, makes beer nicely crisp and well balanced. My first dunkelweizen, surprised me positively.
Paulaner makes excellent weiss-bier, and the Hefeweizen Dunkel is certainly on of the. Aroma of fruits and caramel, nice dark amber color and a long-lasting head
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2005 Aroma of banana and yeast. Semi-dark, white head. Nice banana flavour. Malty and semi-sweet. Acidic aftertaste.
Nice looking dunkles. Hazy brown with a nice head. Fruit, yeast and some sharpness in the nose. Yeats, candied fruits, spices in the flavor. Decent.
Beautiful creamy head on top of a hazy orange brown body. Nose of yeast, cinnamon, wheat, fruit. Spicy flavor with yeast, malt and fruit. Fairly thin and watery.

Bottle, from Beers of Europe (website). Red/brown, hazy without being opaque.  Slight, loose, tan head. Combination of yeast and bubblegum flavour - medium length finish, slightly minty and numbing on the tongue. Little complexity, but very tasty.  This is a dark Hefe, that seems to improve as you get further into the pint.  Some flavours begin to emerge in the finish - even some fruit, once the chill diminishes.

Bottled. Brownish foam, small size bubbles with a continuous perlage, head disappears slowly, glass sticking.
Dark amber to light brown colour, hazy. "Warm" spicy aroma (clove, nutmeg, cinnamon), fruity (ripe banana, dried banana), weak yeasty (dough, boiled meat) on a base of toasted malt. 
Taste of ripe fruit, light yeasty flavor. Honeyish charachter, no bitterness, finish dry, well balanced. Medium to light body, creamy texture, high carbonation.
Aromatic, spicy charachter, an "autumnal" weizen.

I bought a case of this a couple of years ago, so this one may be a bit old.  Nice head, nice dark brown color as you'd expect.  The flavor is a bit bitter and has a wheat wang to it that's maybe sharper than it was when this beer was fresh.  Nice yeasty flavor and hints of carmel and a sligh off flavor of cabbage which isn't all bad in this beer.
Wheat, some spices in aroma, bit sweet. Orange brown coloured, cloudy with a lasting head. Taste is sweet, malty, some citrus. Palate is wheaty with some bitterness. Decent brew.
An unclear dark amber beer with a great head. The aroma is a powerful wheat aroma and somewhat sweet. The flavor is a really nice round wheat flavor. Great for a wheat beer.
brown color, cream head, Nice finish.  Smooth going down, Good afternoon beer.
Bottled. Muddy orange-brown with creamy, lively head. Medium estery banana aroma. Sweet and lightly roasty with notes of vanilla. Banana finish.
wheaty nose with hints of cloves, cloudy copper hue with a massive foamy head, malts, bananas and strawberries, syrupy with a malt aftertaste
Murky brown beer, with hints of nutmeg and cinnimon in the aroma.  Typical dunkel flavour, but slightly too watery.  A pleasant enough beer but I have had better dunkels.

Nice dunkel, nothing special or distinguishing though.  I had it on tap, and it had a small but rich head, with a weak wheat/grainy aroma.  No citrus at all, not as much wheat characteristic as I expected.
Pretty dark appearance. It has a typical wheat taste, with a fresh, citrus-like flavor and therefore easy to drink.
lovely wheat, one of my favs. would recommend

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2004 Draught, Paulaner Beer Garden, BangkokOpaque chestnut colour.  Aroma of banana, toast, milk chocolate, brown sugar.  Sweet palate shows a slightly nutmeggy banana flavour with bready notes and sweaty yeast.
Nothing beats a Dunkelweisse in Germany. This rating is for the tap version. Rocky full head gives way to a banana-like flavor that is persistent throughout the glass. Kicks butt !

Has a hazy amber colour. Huge light brown head, that last. Aroma is typical wheat. Banana and malts. The flavour isnt as distinct as Ive seen in other wheats. Flavour is yeasty. Has a pleasant aftertaste, that has a medium durability. Quite nice wheat.
A good weizen.  Dark almost muddy in color.  Nice fruity nose.  There is a definite malted wheat flavor noticed.  Finish is dry and slightly malty. Good stuff.

I love Paulaner, they really know how to do wheat right.  This is a great, slightly toastier version of their Hefeweizen which I highly recommend.  You will find it a bit thicker and more flavorful than either Schneider Weisse or Franziskaner.

Im not a big fan of Hefe-weizen beer but this dunkel was pretty good.  the flavor and aroma were sweet and appetizing. the color was a cloudy golden amber and the head was thick, as it should be.  A good wheat beer.
good wheat aroma and nice thick head,slighty roasted tone,a little sour but not much of an overall taste
This beer really decribes the Bavarian region of Germany!! This style of beer, is only popular in this region.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2009 Dark brown coloured, big brown head. Aroma of wheat and malts. Relatively thin mouthfeel, some caramel. Not that interesting compared to the competition.

Dark cloudy brown.
To keep it simple - it tasted exactly like it should! :-) Except that it could be a hint more malty.
Light bodied, bubbly.
Malty aroma with chocolate and banana. Almost creamy taste with banana and chocolate. Slightly herbal. Excellent beer!
Nose yeasty and somkey. Also a hint of nutbread. Tastes like that too and also honey. Red brown color with a nice sticky head. Fullmouth and chewy. Nice wheat!

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2003 Pours a cloudy light amber color, huge frothy off white head that lasts, fruity spicy aromas of apple, caremel and bananas. Sweet fruity wheat and caremel flavors, very spicy and yeasty. Medium body and has a soft and creamy and somewhat watery mouthfeel, very light and drinkable, I will have to try another bottle of this.
UPDATED: APR 1, 2004 Dark milky beer. A sweet aroma with some flowers. Small bubbles yielding a creamy head. A nice weissbeer.

Yellow-brown hazy colour with interesting yellowish beige head. A full body contributed to by many fine bubbles and a very smooth mouth feel. Strong wheat, popcorn, and some sourdough flavours topped with a dry then faint sweet finish. Nice stuff!
brown colour, giant creamy head, banana aroma, moderate maltiness, (too) sweet, banana finish - a little bit disgusting at the end of the bottle

Dirty yellow-brown colour with a large off-white head.  Distinctive yeast aroma.  Mild, sweet, fruity flavour without really anyy malt or hop flavours.  Thin bodied and clean.  Ive had better dunkels.
I am not a Hefe fan...but this stuff is damn good...if you like Hefe you will like this beer.

Yeah! Huge nose filled with estery and malty aromas, with strong teriaki-like tones.  Dark, cloudy brown color. The flavor is rich and wonderfully complex. A little chocolate comes through the yeasty taste profile. Big and chewy. Highly carbonated.  Mmm, Mmm, Good!
pretty good weiss beer.  has a bright citrus flavor.
two words: Excellent Beer
Nice and smooth dunkel with a nice fruity flavour (banana and citrus), very tasty and very easy to drink.
Well rounded, a little bit on the sweet side. Good hops makes a long finnish. Average for the style.
reminds me slightly of a belgian ale, salty and fat. looks glorious. nice fruit that lingers
A great dunkel weizen.
Roasty, dark taste for a weizen; quite well-balanced and mellow. A good beer for any occasion.
UPDATED: MAR 8, 2003 Great beer, they totally know how to make this stuff in germany. Strong flavor for a wheat beer.
Excellent dunkel weizen. Even better than their hefeweizen i thought. Great tasting clove and banana flavor.
Im not a huge fan of German brewed wheat beers.
A great beer.  Definite banana/clove (apple??) nose. A nice looking beer.  Im not a huge fan of wheat beers, but this stuff was great.

A well done German Dunkelweisse. Deep amber color; has all the usual spicy clove, banana and vanilla overtones in the aromaand flavor; smooth and creamy, goes down easy; not as hefty in the toasted carmel malt profile as some others of the style, but well done just the same. Very nice on tap.

This beer was SOUR. Maybe I got a bad batch. It took a little getting used to. It is beautiful in appearance, but bleh...I expected more from Paulaner...it was too sour at first sip...okay once you got to it...but too sour at first.
2nd most favorite from Paulaner, Strong, hoppy, thick rich and strong flavors pop right from the bottle, and last till the last drop slides out of the glass.
